Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent

Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent Class Reference

Defines all of the know properties that can be specified for a calendar event. The data source the calendar is bound to for its events could be a list of these objects, but isnt required. More...

Properties

string Location [get, set]
 Specifies the physical location the event takes place at. Currently, the calendar control will only use this for the tooltip if the Tooltip property isnt specified.
string Description [get, set]
 Specifies a basic description of the event. Currently, the calendar control will only use this for the tooltip if the Tooltip property isnt specified.
DateTime StartDate [get, set]
DateTime EndDate [get, set]
string EventType [get, set]
 Currently, only "event" and "disabled" can be specified. Disabled events cannot be selected in the calendar control by the user. Both standard and disabled events can control their css and tooltip with the other properties of this class.
string Tooltip [get, set]
 The specific tooltip to use for the event. If not specified, the calendar will use the Location and Description properties for the day's tooltip. If those are not specified, then the tooltip will be the given date.
string CssClass [get, set]
 The CSS class name to use for the day.
string CssStyle [get, set]
 Provides the specific css style information to use on the anchor element for the given date.

Detailed Description

Defines all of the know properties that can be specified for a calendar event. The data source the calendar is bound to for its events could be a list of these objects, but isnt required.

Property Documentation

string Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.Location [get, set]

Specifies the physical location the event takes place at. Currently, the calendar control will only use this for the tooltip if the Tooltip property isnt specified.

string Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.Description [get, set]

Specifies a basic description of the event. Currently, the calendar control will only use this for the tooltip if the Tooltip property isnt specified.

DateTime Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.StartDate [get, set]

DateTime Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.EndDate [get, set]

string Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.EventType [get, set]

Currently, only "event" and "disabled" can be specified. Disabled events cannot be selected in the calendar control by the user. Both standard and disabled events can control their css and tooltip with the other properties of this class.

string Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.Tooltip [get, set]

The specific tooltip to use for the event. If not specified, the calendar will use the Location and Description properties for the day's tooltip. If those are not specified, then the tooltip will be the given date.

string Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.CssClass [get, set]

The CSS class name to use for the day.

Because events are represented as an html anchor, the name specified here are just the simple class name, but the CSS definition of the class needs to be very specific to the theme being used by the control. For example, if you specify the CssClass 

CalEvent_Birthday
, your css file sould have an element named 
.[ThemeName] .ntb-calendar a.CalEvent_Birthday:link
or many style properties will not work properly. For example, if you are using the lepord theme, your css file will contain a class named 
.leopard .ntb-calendar a.CalEvent_Birthday:link
.

string Nitobi.BaseCalendarEvent.CssStyle [get, set]

Provides the specific css style information to use on the anchor element for the given date.

If you dont want to deal with the complexities of using CSS class names and having to provide class names for each nitobi theme you want to use, specifing style information here will override everything provided in the CSS class definitions.
